ratings.comment: The workload was not bad, but the grading was strict. Was knocked out of the A range by constantly receiving a 9.2/10 on every assignment. Most of the feedback received was "looks good", and never gave any indication of why I had lost points. Very irritating to get a 94.5% and still not get an A. Graders just want you to write to their beliefs.

His class was very enjoyable and easy to complete. However, he has a very strict grading policy and an A in his classes are 96% and he offers 0 extra credit. I was 4 points from an A with a 94% in his class and he refused to bump my grade. He also is very passive aggressive and pretentious.
Easy ethnic studies.  Would recommend it to anyone.  Plus the content was pretty interesting.  No exams... just two papers, a 300 word response every week, and a 5 question quiz every week.
A lot of reading and writing, but if you commit time to your weekly assignments, you'll do fine.

Online ethnic studies class. Nervous about the class being online, but the material was really interesting. Weekly 5 pt quizzes and 300 word responses, 2 papers, and 2 self-reflections. NO EXAM. Very easy. Shah very clear about the expectations and deadlines and made himself available for questions. I would definitely recommend, I learned a lot.
Not a very flexible professor. Took his class online; it was hard to get feedback in a timely matter, didn't show any care for the students (cold), TA was similar.

The class has moved to an online platform. This seems great but there is a ton to do. It's easy to get behind. He is also very vague on assignment due dates. For example: there are 15 modules to complete (you would think this means one a week). He wanted 13 done by 1st week of november. Everyone rushed to finish and this resulted in awful grades.

LOVE SHAH! Also loved the class.  It was late in the day and I still wanted to pay attention -- which says a lot. One of my favorite courses of UW. Transparent professor, tells you want he's looking for. You have to do the work to get the grade but it's not difficult - just have to put time into it

Before Professor Shah's class, I was unaware of how the media mistreats minorities, because I accepted this depiction as the status quo. His class opened up my eyes and now I'll never be the same again. He is also a fun lecturer, shows interesting clips and videos and encourages discussion. He's a great instructor, especially for an ethnic studies.

Worst professor I've had. Boring as can be. Self-obsessed. Not sure whether angry at class or professor for teaching class but every lecture (which I was required to attend)was about as captivating and important as watching an elderly man clip his toe nails.

He was a very captivating lecturer. He puts no grades online though. Your whole grade is based upon 2 papers (25%) each, two midterms (20%) each and participation (10%). Throughout the semester he seemed to be a fair grader. Participate a lot though! I talked at least once per discussion and he still gave me a 20% on participation.

THE WORST CLASS EVER. Professor is horrible and the topic at hand is so dumb. Not to mention the TA speaks no english. The professor does not talk at all with his TA so their grading standards are much different. You will satisfy one of their requirements but then the other teacher will grade the assignment and you could get a bad grade.
Hemant's stature and mannerisms are those of the quintessential college professor. He is measured, clear, bemused, and slightly whimsical. You will enjoy his calm, clear, and interesting lectures.
